event.summary: 11/04/1993: In a large-scale coordinated attack across Western Europe, members of the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) were responsible for firebombing and sabotaging a number of Turkish-owned businesses and targets. In this attack, perpetrators sabotaged a number of Turkish-owned businesses and targets. In this attack, perpetrators sabotaged a Turkish-owned bank in Vienna resulting in no injuries.
event.motive: Reaction to a Turkish military campaign against the Kurds in southeastern Turkey.
event.addnotes: This was one attack of around 60 that occurred at Turkish establishments across Europe. (cf. 199311040001-22).
event.scite1: Center for Terrorism and Intelligence Studies, Critical Infrastructure Terrorist Attack Database, San Jose, CA: Akribis Group, July 7 2006.
